page.title: 12SERVICES: Buses & Power
page.content: The{Broughton & Mottisfont Village {Bus}is a community project started in 1980 because the local bus service was so poor. It provides a regular weekly service to several neighbouring towns. The mini-bus is available for hire when it is not on scheduled service. The drivers are all volunteers. The{pipeline}comes from Fawley & goes over Broughton Downs to the Midlands; it carries oil and petrol. It was finished in this area in July 1985. Our main{Electricity}supply comes from the Rectory Lane sub-station. Most power is carried on overhead power lines, but in the village cables have been put underground.
